justification: “Hypothesis 1: Higher frequency of choosing stimuli during the training of the Reward Pairs task is associated with more strongly habitual behavior during the test phase.”

“we designed a novel paradigm that manipulates instructed choice frequency but is completely free from external reinforcement (Unrewarded Habit task)… Hypothesis 2: Higher frequency … is associated with more strongly habitual behavior during the test phase.”

“As a benchmark paradigm of habit induction, the first outcome devaluation task (Tricomi et al., 2009)… Behavior is deemed habitual in this task if participants… do not adapt their level of responding after devaluation.”
“A second previously published outcome devaluation task (Luque et al., 2020) will provide another benchmark measure of habit… this paradigm … operationalizes habits as RT switch costs.”
“We will use a modified version of the contingency degradation task designed by Vaghi et al. (2019) to capture the second criterion of the traditional habit definition.”
“We also assess model-free reinforcement learning in a sequential Markov decision task (2-Step; Kool et al., 2016)”—the task is treated as one of “six habit paradigms.”
“we use the Self-Report Habit Index (SRHI; Verplanken & Orbell, 2003)… Responses to the SHRI revealed relations with actual observations of real-life habits in previous studies.”
“the Creature of Habit Scale (COHS; Ersche et al., 2017) consists of 27 items… used as real-life habit measures to validate the experimental measures of habitual behavior.”
“the Habitual Tendencies Questionnaire (HTQ; Ramakrishnan et al., 2021) is an eleven-item self-report questionnaire … the total score will be used for further analyses [of habitual behavior].”
“In the NMU task, participants have to memorize numbers and update them… The outcome measure is the total proportion of items recalled correctly… we use three tasks … as working memory marker tasks.”
“In the SSTM, participants have to memorize the position of several dots… The participant-specific total sum of points … yields a proportion correct… chosen as a working-memory marker.”
“The SS task is a complex-span paradigm … The outcome measure is the total proportion of correctly recalled consonants … used to measure working memory capacity.”
“we include the Social Desirability Scale (SDS-17)… a 16-item self-report questionnaire to measure social desirability in general.”
“The Edinburgh Handedness Inventory (EHI; Oldfield, 1971) … Answers are coded… sum scores represent strong right- or left-handedness.”
“The Trier Inventory for Chronic Stress (TICS)… is a self-report questionnaire … which assesses chronic stress on nine factors.”
“We will implement the trait version of the State/Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI; Spielberger et al., 1999)… assessing general feelings of anxiousness.”
“The Barratt Impulsiveness Scale short form (BIS-15)… is a 15-item self-report questionnaire used to measure impulsive behavior.”
